channel.title: ::commands
channel.description:
i know how to make teleport commands and give item commands and even staff commands but i dont know how to make a command list that lists all of the commands for players and staff.
can anyone help me?

item.title: ::commands
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

ok, i think i know what you mean since i have a command and it comes up with all the commands in my server.

1.i will not try to spoonfeed but it is hard if you dont know what your doing and do not have one already in your server.

  1. go into client.java and search for your commands.

  2. make a command like this.

        } else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("your command name here")) {

you then need to add what your command is going to say when u do it in your server so do an enter and add this.

            name here();

it will look like this.

[code] } else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“your command name here”)) {

        name here();[/code]

you will need to make a void.

somewhere up past commands.

    public void the name here() {

you will then need to put what it will say.

[code] public void name here() {

    sendQuest("@dre@commands!", 8144); // Title
    clearQuestInterface();
    sendQuest( "what you want it to say.", 8145);
    sendQuest( "what you want it to say.", 8146);
    sendQuest( "what you want it to say.", 8147);[/code]

if you want to add more lines to the command just carry on what it says with 8148 8149 ect ect.

after you have done what you want it do you need to add:

[code] sendQuestSomething(8143);
showInterface(8134);
flushOutStream();

}[/code]

basically,

command:

[code] } else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“your command name here”)) {

        name here();[/[/code]

what it will say:

[code] public void name here() {

    sendQuest("@dre@commands!", 8144); // Title
    clearQuestInterface();
    sendQuest( "what you want it to say.", 8145);
    sendQuest( "what you want it to say.", 8146);
    sendQuest( "what you want it to say.", 8147);
    sendQuestSomething(8143);
    showInterface(8134);
    flushOutStream();

good luck with your server, hope i made sence. if u want more detail just pm me and i will show you with screenies ect.

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: ::commands
item.dc:creator: @TheMyth TheMyth
item.description:
@TheMyth wrote:

If you want to make a command usable for staff members you just need to add an if statement onto the command so it only checks it if your staff.

example:

if(command.startsWith("givemod")){

Would be if(command.startsWith("givemod") && playerRights > 1){

The playerRights > 1 means that if the player has rights bigger then 1 (mod) then they will be able to use the command.

Just incase you dont know them, heres a list of the numbers allocated to differnt playerRights:

[ul]Player - 0
Mod - 1
Admin - 2
Owner - 3
Hidden Admin - 4[/ul]

Hope this helps m8 :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 28, 2009, 03:26:45 pm[/size][hr]Sorry scrap my last post I didnt read it properly, what you want is an sendquest that will show all your commands.
This is pretty damn easy to make so ill just show you

Ok first off youre going to need to make a void that does the sendquest. so you would use something like this:

[code] public void commandMenu() {

    sendQuest("Commands", 8144); // Title
    clearQuestInterface();
    sendQuest("Command list", 8145);
    sendQuest("", 8147);
    sendQuest("", 8148);
    sendQuest("", 8149);
    sendQuest("", 8150);
    sendQuest("", 8151);
    sendQuestSomething(8143);
    showInterface(8134);
    flushOutStream();
	
}[/code]

is the sendquests inbetween the "s you would add your text (say your command) so if you wanted it to show the command yell you would put:

        sendQuest("::yell", 8147);

Note that the number at the end of the sndquest (the 8147 above) is the line you want the code to be on, you can have as many lines as you want, just c&p one of your previous lines and put the number of the last line in your void+1.

Now to open this void you will need a command, so say:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("commands")){ commandMenu(); }

If you ahve any further questions on how to do this just post em

Read full topic

item.title: ::commands
item.dc:creator: @x_pk3r_xx x pk3r xx
item.description:
@x_pk3r_xx wrote:

chrissy dee:

can u help me with the staff commands im new to this…

i dont know if its allowed to spoonfeed, so…
start off with this: if (command.startsWith("giveadmin") && playerRights >= 3) {

than add a line that directs to the name after the command giveadmin like this:

String name = command.substring(10);

than add something that makes the playerhandler give the player playerrights 2, savemoreinfo, savechar, disconnect = true.

dont forget the catch exception part.

done?

OT: you could be making it open an interface, than enter the lines that it should say apart from the interface. shouldn’t be to hard but never tryed this.
